text.p: These are the leading stories in the Egyptian press on Wednesday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- President Hosni Mubarak and Saudi Crown Prince Abdullah hold talks on bilateral relations and the peace process. The Saudi prince says that his visit aims to strengthen ties.
- Four terrorists are killed in a battle with security forces in Minya.
- Privatisation committee agrees to restructure 50 companies technically and administratively after financial restructuring to prepare them for investment.
- Mercedes will produce cars in Egypt from the end of the year through a German-Egyptian company with a capital of 150 million pounds.
- Minister of State for Military Production Mohamed el-Ghamrawi says there will be no privatisation of military production industries.
- Palestinian President Yasser Arafat and Mubarak to hold talks today on the peace process.
- Presidential envoy Osama al-Baz went to Washington to brief U.S. government officials on the results of his talks with Israeli and Palestinian leaders.
- Egypt finds a source of gold in southwest of the country.

- Mubarak and Crown Prince Abdullah discuss five major points including Arab solidarity, setting up an Arab common market, the peace process, strengthening bilateral ties, and the Middle East economic summit to be held in Qatar.
- Seventy-nine companies have been privatised through the end of May and ten more are expected to be sold in June.
